items.title: VIDEO-RANGE is not supported in playlist stream_info
items.body:
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:BANDWIDTH=4236849,AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH=4167098,VIDEO-RANGE=SDR,CODECS="avc1.4d401f,mp4a.40.2",RESOLUTION=1280x720,FRAME-RATE=24.000,AUDIO="program_audio_0"

This is pretty common with HDR content now. Older content uses a value of "SDR" (standard dynamic range) for VIDEO-RANGE and new HDR content is usually something like PQ (perceptual quant).

It would be great to support this.

items.title: handle audio channels
items.body: Ref https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-pantos-hls-rfc8216bis-07#page-38

items.title: frame rate should be rounded to 3 decimal places
items.body:
Per https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-pantos-hls-rfc8216bis-07#page-41

Should probably use `'FRAME-RATE=%.3g' % self.frame_rate` instead of `'FRAME-RATE=%.5g' % self.frame_rate` at https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/blob/master/m3u8/model.py#L915

items.title: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'm3u8'
items.body: Getting module not found error, even after installing with pip

items.title: Short segment duration is formatted in scientific notation which violates the spec for EXTINF
items.body:
Short segments are re-formatted in scientific notation(`e-05`) which violates the [decimal floating point spec](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8216#section-4.3.2.1).

Using the attached file perform the following

```
>>> p = m3u8.load("index-source-test.m3u8.txt")
>>> o = p.dumps()
>>> f = open('/tmp/index-source-lib.m3u8', 'w')
>>> f.write(o)
```

```
cat /tmp/index-source-lib.m3u8

#EXTM3U
#EXT-X-VERSION:3
#EXT-X-TARGETDURATION:4
#EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE:VOD
#EXTINF:1.1e-05,
segment0.ts?flagset=source
#EXT-X-ENDLIST
```

You can see that `#EXTINF:0.000011` got reformatted into `#EXTINF:1.1e-05`

items.title: about #EXTINF
items.body:
I have checked "HTTP Live Streaming" protocol that is said the format is ```#EXTINF:<duration>,[<title>]```. Your library follow it. 

But I found many M3U instance which format is ```#EXTINF:-1 tvg-id="" ....``` from https://github.com/iptv-org/iptv

May you give me advice how to load and process them?

items.title: Why "For unencrypted segments, the initial key would be None"?
items.body:
When I read the code,I find the comment “For unencrypted segments, the initial key would be None”.
What is this feature for? When I work with a m3u8, I expect  unencrypted segments return keys as a empty list. (Because I use `for key in keys` to execute, in this case `[None]` is really annoying).

items.title: Base Paths/URIs not applied to some types
items.body:
Looks like some types that are derived from `BasePathMixin` (at least `PartialSegment`, `InitializationSegment`, `RenditionReport`) do not have their base_path or base_uri updated as they are not considered in the `M3U8` setter methods.

I will put a PR together soon.

items.title: Handling a negative EXT-X-MEDIA-SEQUENCE
items.body:
So, this is completely nonstandard (decimal-integer is defined to start at 0), but I have encountered a number of streams that provide a negative media-sequence in conjunction with EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY. Thanks to `normalize_attribute`, this library ends up throwing a ValueError when it tries to cast e.g. "_3" to an int. 

Is there any way to work around this? Or can the parser be changed to, well, *not* normalize EXT-X-MEDIA-SEQUENCE values? I'm not entirely sure why it does so currently.

items.title: EXTINF 0 duration not getting emitted
items.body: I'm not well versed in m3u8 files but this [change](https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/commit/5f20f642656b7b08cadd37ae6d739319209ad12f#diff-fec17f607e26e0fa22d53e02524a5674L385) caused the EXTINF header to not be emitted for falsey durations. I'm not sure if this is intended but I noticed this my tests broke after upgrading since I create fake zero-duration tracks as part of my project's test suite.

items.title: Add support for FRAME-RATE tag
items.body:
Tag `FRAME-RATE` is ignored when parsing and dumping a master playlist.

For example when [master-with-stream-inf-1.m3u8](https://github.com/grafov/m3u8/blob/master/sample-playlists/master-with-stream-inf-1.m3u8), which contains `FRAME-RATE` tag, is loaded:
```
m3u8_obj = m3u8.load('master-with-stream-inf-1.m3u8')
```
And then dumped:
```
print(m3u8_obj.dumps())
```
The `FRAME-RATE` tag is gone:
```
#EXTM3U
#EXT-X-VERSION:3
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=300000,AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH=300000,CODECS="avc1.42c015,mp4a.40.2"
chunklist-b300000.m3u8
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=600000,AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH=600000,CODECS="avc1.42c015,mp4a.40.2"
chunklist-b600000.m3u8
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=850000,AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH=850000,CODECS="avc1.42c015,mp4a.40.2"
chunklist-b850000.m3u8
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=1000000,AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH=1000000,CODECS="avc1.42c015,mp4a.40.2"
chunklist-b1000000.m3u8
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=1500000,AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH=1500000,CODECS="avc1.42c015,mp4a.40.2"
chunklist-b1500000.m3u8
```

The solution would be probably to extend `stream_info` for `Playlist` class.

items.title: helper function to download the video

items.title: Add PDT tag to segment wihtout DISCONTINUITY tag being True.
items.body:
I noticed a small discrepancy between the doc and the code. In `model.py`, the PDT(Program-Date-Time) tag for a **segment** is added only when the DISCONTINUITY tag is set to TRUE. This can be found in the method `dump` of class `segment`. 

I think these should be independent of each other? The only relation that I could find between them is that if server provides PDT tags, then it must add PDT tags to all the segments which have DISCONTINUITY tags.

items.title: m3u8.loads with custom_tags_parser raise TypeError
#EXT-X-CUE-IN and #EXT-X-CUE-OUT are not dumped
items.body:
Example source m3u8:
```
#EXTM3U
#EXT-X-VERSION:3
#EXT-X-TARGETDURATION:2
#EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE:EVENT
#EXT-X-MEDIA-SEQUENCE:0
...
#EXT-X-CUE-OUT:30.000
#EXTINF:1.998,
1554363130757.ts
...
#EXTINF:2.001,
1554363142762.ts
#EXT-X-CUE-IN
#EXTINF:1.999,
1554363144762.ts
...
```

When it is parsed and dumped to a file the `#EXT-X-CUE-OUT` markers are replaced with `#EXT-X-CUE-OUT-CONT` with no duration and the `#EXT-X-CUE-IN` markers do not appear.

```
#EXTM3U
#EXT-X-VERSION:3
#EXT-X-TARGETDURATION:2
#EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE:EVENT
#EXT-X-MEDIA-SEQUENCE:0
...
#EXT-X-CUE-OUT-CONT
#EXTINF:1.998,
1554363130757.ts
...
#EXTINF:2.001,
1554363142762.ts
#EXTINF:1.999,
1554363144762.ts
...
```

items.title: Basic support for custom tags
items.body:
Sometimes services add custom tags that they use for their own purposes. Custom tags are also started with `#EXT`. Applications are going to ignore them as it is written in RFC8216. But these tags can be also helpful depending on service. Currently, the library ignores custom tags recognizing them as a comment.
What do you think about saving custom tags started with `#EXT` somewhere in the model? Or specifing additional protocols for `parser` function?

items.title: Parsing extended #EXTINF tags
items.body:
### Context

According to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M3U), m3u is a _de facto_ standard, which implies that its implementation might vary across different platforms, software or use cases.

In particular, I have recently been confronted with a couple of implementations that are not compliant with [this spec](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-pantos-http-live-streaming-20), which seems to be this repo's reference.

[Here](https://siptv.eu/howto/playlist.html) and [here](https://wiki.tvip.ru/en/m3u) are two simple descriptions of such implementations, and here is an extract of such a m3u8 file :
```
#EXTM3U
#EXTINF:-1 tvg-id="Be1.be" tvg-name="Be1 Alt" group-title="News" parent-code="1234" audio-track="nl",Be1 Name
http://channel.stream.address/to_be_placed/on_separate_line/123.ts
```

### Proposed addition to the parser

**Adding a parser option allowing to parse these extended tags and retrieve them in segments.**

I can fork the project and create a pull request implementing this feature, but I would like to make sure that it fits with the project's orientation.

items.title: #EXT-X-MEDIA uri is optional
items.body:
I have a m3u8 master playlist with an ext-x-media tag without any uri attribute.
It is an audio group where the uri is found in an #EXT-X-STREAM-INF.

The parser fails when I use base_path, because setting base_path calls
os.path.dirname(self.uri), when self.uri is None.

File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/m3u8/mixins.py", line 33, in base_path
    return os.path.dirname(self.uri)

According to the specification, the uri in media tag is optional when the type is audio or video:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-pantos-http-live-streaming-21#section-4.3.4.2.1

#EXT-X-MEDIA:TYPE=AUDIO,GROUP-ID="audio-aacl-312",NAME="English",LANGUAGE="en",AUTOSELECT=YES,DEFAULT=YES,CHANNELS="2"
 
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:BANDWIDTH=364000,AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH=331000,CODECS="mp4a.40.2",AUDIO="audio-aacl-312",SUBTITLES="textstream"
ch001-audio_312640_eng=312000.m3u8

[index.txt](https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/files/1349168/index.txt)

items.title: #EXT-X-MAP:URI and #EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME ignored in dump
items.body:
The **#EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME** is ignored when dumping m3u8 object to string.

Also the segment level **#EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME** is ignored.
The global one gets dumped ok.

items.title: m3u8.dump() throws when relative filepath does not contain any directories
items.body:
```python
In [39]: master.dump("master.m3u8")
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
FileNotFoundError                         Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-39-a612dd8dcc84> in <module>()
----> 1 master.dump("master.m3u8")

/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/m3u8/model.py in dump(self, filename)
    271         Saves the current m3u8 to ``filename``
    272         '''
--> 273         self._create_sub_directories(filename)
    274
    275         with open(filename, 'w') as fileobj:

/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/m3u8/model.py in _create_sub_directories(self, filename)
    279         basename = os.path.dirname(filename)
    280         try:
--> 281             os.makedirs(basename)
    282         except OSError as error:
    283             if error.errno != errno.EEXIST:

/usr/lib/python3.5/os.py in makedirs(name, mode, exist_ok)
    239             return
    240     try:
--> 241         mkdir(name, mode)
    242     except OSError:
    243         # Cannot rely on checking for EEXIST, since the operating system

```

It fails due to `_create_sub_directories` assumption that a filepath will have a `basename` which is not a case for relative paths without directories such as "master.m3u8". This might be an edge case but it has cost me few minutes of debugging ;)

items.title: Error parsing line #EXT-X-MAP:URI="main.mp4",BYTERANGE="812@0"
items.body:
Apple 'Advanced stream (HEVC/H.264)' reference has #EXT-X-MAP:URI="main.mp4",BYTERANGE="812@0" attribute. This attribute parses as segment_map_uri with incorrect value 'main.mp4",BYTERANGE="812@0'. But should be parsed as separate 'uri' and 'byterange'.

Link to m3u8:
https://tungsten.aaplimg.com/VOD/bipbop_adv_example_hevc/tp10/iframe_index.m3u8

Link to examples:
https://developer.apple.com/streaming/examples/

items.title: Doesn't parse #EXT-X-MAP attribute in m3u8
items.body:
Some playlists contain #EXT-X-MAP:URI="fileSequence0.mp4" and this attribute doesn't processed.

>    The EXT-X-MAP tag specifies how to obtain the Media Initialization
>    Section (Section 3) required to parse the applicable Media Segments.
>    It applies to every Media Segment that appears after it in the
>    Playlist until the next EXT-X-MAP tag or until the end of the
>    playlist.
> 
>    Its format is:
> 
>    #EXT-X-MAP:<attribute-list>

https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-pantos-http-live-streaming-21#section-4.3.2.5

items.title: SSL Error Handling
items.body: When you parse an https m3u8 manifest file without valid SSL certificate the load function crashes reporting ssl.CertificateError and since the load function is based on URLLIB it would be nice if you could add the load(url, verify = False) statement, to skip the SSL check.

The error
```
  File "m3u8/model.py", line 139, in __init__

  File "m3u8/parser.py", line 119, in parse
    _parse_stream_inf(line, data, state)

    state['stream_info'] = _parse_attribute_list(protocol.ext_x_stream_inf, line, atribute_parser)
  File "m3u8/parser.py", line 215, in _parse_attribute_list
    value = atribute_parser[name](value)
ValueError: invalid literal for int() with base 10: '66406.2'
```
The m3u8
```
#EXTM3U
#EXT-X-VERSION:3
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:BANDWIDTH=66406.2,RESOLUTION=640x360,CODECS="avc1.640028,mp4a.40.2"
chunks.m3u8
```

items.title: Add the ability to set headers for URI
items.body:
Some sites require setting some headers like ``Referer`` or ``Cookie``, even the ``UserAgent`` sometimes, to access the the content and don't be filtered by the webserver. Using ``m3u8.load()`` won't allow you to setup anything of the sort.

Of course, it is possible to bypass the issue by making the request by hand using ``urllib.request`` module and then ``m3u8.loads()`` but it adds extra  complexity and the resulting m3u8 objects (playlists or segments) lack of some attributes like ``.absolute_uri`` then.

One possible solution is to add an extra argument to ``m3u8.load()``, for example ``headers={}``, and when set to anything different than that, make the request using ``Request()`` and then ``urlopen()`` inside the ``m3u8.load()`` method.

items.title: Support for Envivio flavored HLS markers
items.body:
Envivio encoders provide a bit different flavour of HLS SCTE 35 cue markers. Would be great to have support for these.

PS: I will provide a PR for this

items.body:
Hi,

items.title: EXTINF tag with optional comma?
items.body: m3u8 library requires EXTINF tag to have title, but the title is optional, see https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-pantos-http-live-streaming-09#section-3.3.2

items.title: BANDWIDTH format change on Twitch playlists
items.body:
It appears that Twitch.tv is breaking/changing specification by producing master playlists that have bandwidth described by a floating point number instead of an integer.

An example of such a playlist can be seen [here](http://pastebin.com/TUUT1YvZ).

Is it possible to accommodate that change by changing the expected bandwidth format in the module?

items.title: Ignore blank lines in m3u8 file
items.body:
I came across a stream with blank lines in the m3u8 file, between each stream info line and uri. In the protocol for these files, it states the blank lines should be ignored. When I ran the parser on it though the uri was being set as an empty string. If I add the following to the for loop in the parse function (in parser.py) it ignores these lines:

`# Ignore blank lines`
`if line == "":`
`continue`

In the HTTP live streaming protocol internet draft, the following appears in section 4.1 Definition of a playlist:
"Each line is a URI, blank, or starts with the character '#'.  Blank lines are ignored."

See the document here:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-pantos-http-live-streaming-18#section-4.1

Is this a reasonable thing for me to submit a patch for?

items.title: How to handle encryption
items.body:
Hi,

I've been using this m3u8 library to download .m3u8 files.
Now I found one with encryption

http://lb.cdn.m6web.fr/s/cu/prime/vod/protected/7/e/b/Enquete-exclusive_c11529756_Daesh-la-multinat/Enquete-exclusive_c11529756_Daesh-la-multinat_400k.mp4.m3u8

the top looks like this
# EXTM3U
# EXT-X-VERSION:3
# EXT-X-TARGETDURATION:7
# EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE:VOD
# EXT-X-FAXS-CM:URI="Enquete-exclusive_c11529756_Daesh-la-multinat_400k.mp4.drm"
# EXT-X-KEY:METHOD=AES-128,URI="faxs://faxs.adobe.com",IV=0x5a8ddab79f4fff6a8333ea8ff64d3cd4
# EXT-X-MEDIA-TIME:0.0
# EXTINF:6,

Enquete-exclusive_c11529756_Daesh-la-multinat_400k.mp4.0_6000.ts?trackid=1,2

I can download the .drm which seems to be related to Flash.
I can download the individual pieces, but they seem to be encrypted.
Anybody knows how the process works?

items.title: Different time parsing functions used in library vs test code
items.body:
The use of the arrow library was removed in https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/pull/40 (https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/issues/38), but then re-added in for the tests in https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/commit/f50cad56e32f3560553bfe47594abcf29fb2a7d9. So currently the m3u8 library and it's tests are using different time parsing functions.

Is there a reason for doing this?

items.title: X-KEY should be rendered for the first segment
items.body:
The HEAD of the repository doesn't currently print the X-KEY attribute for the first item of the playlist.
Here is [an example from the RFC](http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-pantos-http-live-streaming-13#section-8.4) where the first segment already has a key.

items.title: non-m3u8 files are silently parsed as a m3u8 with nothing inside
items.body: Try parsing, for instance, the output from "curl http://example.com/nonexistant.m3u8". No warning or error

items.title: KEYFORMAT and KEYFORMATVERSIONS not supported in EXT-X-KEY
items.body:
New fields were added to EXT-X-KEY tag since the original writing:
http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-pantos-http-live-streaming-16#section-4.3.2.4

items.title: Comments are not preserved through loads() + dumps()
items.body:
The hls spec permits comments (c.f. https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-pantos-http-live-streaming-16#section-4.1, 3rd paragraph).

Some tools use comments to provide extensions to compatible players (such as brightcove zencoder). Preserving comments in their proper locations would interoperate better with such tools.

Here's an example of a playlist with a brightcove-like comment, and which fails the test_dumps_should_build_same_string test:

```
PLAYLIST_WITH_COMMENT = '''
#EXTM3U
#EXT-X-VERSION:3
#EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE:VOD
#EXT-X-TARGETDURATION:8
#EXTINF:8,
http://media.example.com/entire.ts
#ZEN-TOTAL-DURATION:8
#EXT-X-ENDLIST
'''
```

(This example also fails because VOD and TARGETDURATION get reordered, a separate issue.)

items.title: m3u8.Media objects have no absolute_uri and don't respect base_uri and base_path from parents.
items.body: Unlike all the rest of the downloadable objects, the Media objects (entries in the Playlist.media list, in M3U8.playlists) have no absolute_uri property that's affected by the parent's base_path and base_uri parameters.

items.title: Incorrect child absolute_uri values generated from base_uri.
items.body:
Passing the original url as the base_uri input parameter to M3U8 constructor (as the description in its help text describes) makes incorrect absolute_uri paths for the child objects.

This code exercises the problem against one of Apple's sample streams:

```
$ python
Python 2.7.6 (default, Sep  9 2014, 15:04:36) 
[GCC 4.2.1 Compatible Apple LLVM 6.0 (clang-600.0.39)] on darwin
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import urllib2, m3u8, urlparse
>>> url='https://devimages.apple.com.edgekey.net/streaming/examples/bipbop_4x3/bipbop_4x3_variant.m3u8'
>>> text=urllib2.urlopen(url).read()
>>> m=m3u8.M3U8(content=text, base_uri=url)
>>> m.playlists[0].absolute_uri
'https://devimages.apple.com.edgekey.net/streaming/examples/bipbop_4x3/bipbop_4x3_variant.m3u8/gear1/prog_index.m3u8'
```

My expectation is that m.playlist[0].absolute_uri would be "https://devimages.apple.com.edgekey.net/streaming/examples/bipbop_4x3/gear1/prog_index.m3u8", as you would get from urlparse.urljoin, which is the actual location of the playlist that a video player would retrieve (a relative path derived from the original uri, NOT a sub-path of the original uri). Continuing on, that url that I was expecting does in fact succeed:

```
>>> urlparse.urljoin(url, m.playlists[0].uri)
'https://devimages.apple.com.edgekey.net/streaming/examples/bipbop_4x3/gear1/prog_index.m3u8'
>>> subtext=urllib2.urlopen(urlparse.urljoin(url, m.playlists[0].uri)).read()
>>> len(subtext)
6701
>>> sub_m=m3u8.M3U8(subtext)
>>> len(sub_m.segments)
181
```

Whereas the absolute_uri from the playlist fails:

```
>>> m.playlists[0].absolute_uri
'https://devimages.apple.com.edgekey.net/streaming/examples/bipbop_4x3/bipbop_4x3_variant.m3u8/gear1/prog_index.m3u8'
>>> m.playlists[0].uri
'gear1/prog_index.m3u8'
>>> subtext=urllib2.urlopen(m.playlists[0].absolute_uri)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 127, in urlopen
    return _opener.open(url, data, timeout)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 410, in open
    response = meth(req, response)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 523, in http_response
    'http', request, response, code, msg, hdrs)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 448, in error
    return self._call_chain(*args)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 382, in _call_chain
    result = func(*args)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 531, in http_error_default
    raise HTTPError(req.get_full_url(), code, msg, hdrs, fp)
urllib2.HTTPError: HTTP Error 404: Not Found
```

For reference, in case it goes down or changes, the present contents of that master playlist url are here:

```
#EXTM3U


#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=232370,CODECS="mp4a.40.2, avc1.4d4015"
gear1/prog_index.m3u8

#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=649879,CODECS="mp4a.40.2, avc1.4d401e"
gear2/prog_index.m3u8

#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=991714,CODECS="mp4a.40.2, avc1.4d401e"
gear3/prog_index.m3u8

#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=1927833,CODECS="mp4a.40.2, avc1.4d401f"
gear4/prog_index.m3u8

#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=41457,CODECS="mp4a.40.2"
gear0/prog_index.m3u8

```

items.title: Remove arrow depencency
items.body:
I think this looks like a nice and simple library for parsing m3u8 playlists, but one thing that kind of ruined that impression was when I realized that it depended on arrow. I'm not saying arrow is a bad library, but it's way to big (with all it's own dependencies) for what it's used for in this project.

Currently arrow is used for two operations:
- One in parser.py: `arrow.get(value).datetime`...
- ... and one in models.py: `arrow.get(self.program_date_time).isoformat()`

So it's basically parsing and formatting date and times in ISO 8601 format. A more lightweight library without additional dependencies for parsing ISO 8601 is https://pypi.python.org/pypi/iso8601. The operations currently done with arrow can be done like this with iso8601:
- `iso8601.parse_date(value)`
- `self.program_date_time.isoformat()`

Completely removing parsing (just providing the value as a string) or making it optional is another way to go.

items.title: Add attribute PROGRAM-DATE-TIME
items.body: Parse playlist and add attribute PROGRAM-DATE-TIME to model

items.title: Segments in playlist (through EXT-X-STREAM-INF)
items.body:
Parsing .m3u8 file with referencing other .m3u8 files, indicating that alternative renditions
   of the content are available for playback of that variant stream. The current implementation cannot handle it.

Given a `TOS-trailer.m3u8` file:

```
#EXTM3U
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=128000,RESOLUTION=426x240
TOS-trailer.hls/p0.m3u8
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=214000,RESOLUTION=426x240
TOS-trailer.hls/p1.m3u8
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=414000,RESOLUTION=426x240
TOS-trailer.hls/p2.m3u8
```

With `TOS-trailer.hls/p0.m3u8` like:

```
#EXTM3U
#EXT-X-VERSION:3
#EXT-X-MEDIA-SEQUENCE:0
#EXT-X-ALLOW-CACHE:YES
#EXT-X-TARGETDURATION:6
#EXTINF:5.083333,
p0/stream_0000.ts
#EXTINF:5.000000,
p0/stream_0001.ts
#EXTINF:5.000000,
p0/stream_0002.ts
```

code snippets:

```
>>> import m3u8
>>> m3u8_obj = m3u8.load('/tmp/TOS-trailer.m3u8')
>>> p0 = m3u8_obj.playlists[0]
>>> p0.stream_info
StreamInfo(bandwidth='128000', program_id='1', resolution=(426, 240), codecs=None)
>>> p0.media
[]
>>> p0.segments
AttributeError: 'Playlist' object has no attribute 'segments'
```

items.title: m3u8 load() function should discover if parameter is URL or content
items.body:
I personally don't like two functions to load m3u8 (loads() and load()). I think we might just have one function that discovers if the argument is a m3u8 URL or its content.

We can deprecate one of the functions on the next version and remove it after two or three tags.

items.title: Open playlist in read mode only
items.body: Since it's not required to write.

items.title: Add Python3 Support
items.body: I want to use m3u8 in my project which is written in Python 3. Sadly I found that m3u8 itself doesn't support Python 3. Is there a plan to support Python 3 in the future?

items.title: int type for bandwidth and program-id fields
items.body: The spec states that both bandwidth and program-id are of type "decimal-integer".  Wouldn't it be best to a) validate and 2) parse these as ints rather than str which they are currently?

items.title: Ability to write m3u8 file
items.body: It would be useful to be able to dynamically create an object representing a stream (with substreams), and output it to a file or stdout. This could be used to create custom HLS servers with non-standard behaviour.

items.title: Handle quotes in parse_stream_inf
items.body:
Hi,
I've found a m3u8 file like that
# EXT-X-STREAM-INF:PROGRAM-ID=1,BANDWIDTH=645000,RESOLUTION=512x288,CODECS="avc1.77.30, mp4a.40.5"

parse stream_inf line around 84 fails because it splits CODECS="avc1.77.30, mp4a.40.5" at the comma
 CODECS="avc1.77.30,
 mp4a.40.5"

I've tried to use csv, but it does not work, I think because the quoting is only for the part after = and not the whole string between ,   ,.

Any idea for an elegant solution?

items.title: basepath should be set for dumps only
M3U8 doesn't understand relative paths
items.body:
We need to handle segments that have a relative path to the m3u8.

For instance, this is a m3u8 created by FMS 4.5.1:

```
#EXTM3U
#EXT-X-MEDIA-SEQUENCE:182498
#EXT-X-ALLOW-CACHE:NO
#EXT-X-VERSION:2
#EXT-X-TARGETDURATION:8
#EXTINF:8,
../../../../hls-live/streams/live_hls/events/testevent/testevent/teststreamNum182498.ts
#EXTINF:8,
../../../../hls-live/streams/live_hls/events/testevent/testevent/teststreamNum182499.ts
#EXTINF:8,
../../../../hls-live/streams/live_hls/events/testevent/testevent/teststreamNum182500.ts
#EXTINF:8,
../../../../hls-live/streams/live_hls/events/testevent/testevent/teststreamNum182501.ts
#EXTINF:8,
../../../../hls-live/streams/live_hls/events/testevent/testevent/teststreamNum182502.ts
#EXTINF:8,
../../../../hls-live/streams/live_hls/events/testevent/testevent/teststreamNum182503.ts
```

items.title: should be able to create m3u8 from scratch
items.body:
Today we need to provide a m3u8 as string to create a `m3u8.M3U8` object. We should be able to create one from scratch:

example:

``` python

import m3u8

playlist_low = m3u8.Playlist('http://videoserver.com/low.m3u8', stream_info={'bandwidth': '1280000'})
playlist_high = m3u8.Playlist('http://videoserver.com/high.m3u8', stream_info={'bandwidth': '3000000'})

obj = m3u8.M3U8()
obj.add_playlist(playlist_low)
obj.add_playlist(playlist_high)

print obj.dumps()
```

The main usage will be to create variant streams index files.

items.title: Translate relative paths to absolute paths
items.body: If the playlist refers to paths relative to the m3u8 path, the parser should translate them to absolute paths
